description: Borrowed from Italian soprano, from Vulgar Latin *superānus, adjective from preposition Latin super (“above”). Doublet of sovereign, from the same Latin root via Old French.

nouns.description: soprano (plural sopranos or soprani or sopranoes)

entries.meaning: Musical part or section higher in pitch than alto and other sections.
Person or instrument that performs the soprano part.

verbs.description: soprano (third-person singular simple present sopranos, present participle sopranoing, simple past and past participle sopranoed)

entries.meaning: To sing or utter with high pitch.
examples: "Sure they ain't done me no harm," sopranoed the woman.
